final_answer.precision_note: Answer given to 3 significant figures based on the precision of the bond energy values (all given to 3 significant figures).

method: Using deltaH = sum(bonds broken) - sum(bonds formed). For CH4 + 2O2 -> CO2 + 2H2O: Bonds broken are 4 C-H bonds (4 x 413 = 1652 kJ) and 2 O=O bonds (2 x 498 = 996 kJ), giving total broken = 2648 kJ. Bonds formed are 2 C=O bonds in CO2 (2 x 805 = 1610 kJ) and 4 O-H bonds in 2H2O (4 x 463 = 1852 kJ), giving total formed = 3462 kJ. Therefore deltaH = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol-1. The negative value indicates an exothermic reaction, consistent with combustion.
